definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
alveolar nasal/consonant n produced in the nose with the tongue against the alveolar ridge
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate

sentences.english: I sound a little bit nasal today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我说话听起来有点鼻音。

sentences.english: "This thing is done, " he said in a sorrowful Texas twang.
sentences.chinese: “我们就这样输了，”他带着德克萨斯鼻音悲伤的说。

sentences.english: My nosy is stuffy so I sound all nasally today.
sentences.chinese: 因为鼻塞，我今天讲话都有鼻音。

sentences.english: I sang it slowly, not without a little twang.
sentences.chinese: 我缓慢唱起来，带着一点鼻音。

sentences.english: In the Ming Dynasty , three nasal finals can be employed together.
sentences.chinese: 《明刊》中三种鼻音尾韵可以通押。

sentences.english: Word-final nasals are much shorter in Chinese than they are in English.
sentences.chinese: 中文中词尾鼻音比英文中的短得多。

sentences.english: He speaks with a heavy twang.
sentences.chinese: 他说话的时候，鼻音很重。

sentences.english: He spoke with a nasal twang.
When she spoke, her voice had a high-pitched, nasal twang .
sentences.chinese: 当她开始说话后，她的声音中带着尖尖的鼻音。

sentences.english: A shrill, nasal tone strikes your listener like chalk screeching on a blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 尖锐的鼻音会让你的听众感觉粉笔划过黑板一样刺耳。

sentences.english: He had a cold and spoke with a slight snuffle.
sentences.chinese: 他感冒了，说话有点鼻音。
他用鼻音讲出自己的建议。

definition: final sound of a syllable/rhyme (e.g. in European languages)
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
diction/enunciation/to pronounce the words correctly (in opera)
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
